main event: A civilian observed a bright, glowing object in the sky over Ruston, Louisiana on the evening of April 22, 1969.
interesting points: The object was brighter than a bright star or planet, and appeared much closer together.
The observer used binoculars to view the object, which had four darker areas and three triangular shapes.
The object emitted a bluish-yellow glow and seemed to be only several feet above the ground.
The object hovered for about 10 minutes before moving off rapidly, then ascending upwards.
The observer had extensive experience using a telescope and was confident the object was not a normal natural phenomenon.
sighted object: a bright, glowing object with four darker areas and three triangular shapes
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
